text: William Desmond Anthony Pertwee, MBE (21 July 1926 - 27 May 2013)"Dad's Army star Bill Pertwee dies aged 86", BBC News, 27 May 2013 was an English comedy actor best known for playing the part of antagonist ARP Warden Hodges in the popular sitcom Dad's Army. Pertwee was born on 21 July 1926 in Amersham, Buckinghamshire, England. He was the second cousin once removed of Michael Pertwee and Jon Pertwee, being the second cousin of their father, screenwriter and actor Roland Pertwee. Pertwee was married to Jean Pertwee from 1960 until they divorced a few months later. Then he was married to Marion Pertwee from 1965 until her death in 2005. He had a son, James Pertwee. Pertwee died on 27 May 2013 in Truro, Cornwall, England from natural causes, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Bill Pertwee recalls his appearance on This Is Your Life Category:1926 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Actors from Buckinghamshire Category:English movie actors Category:English radio actors Category:English stage actors Category:English television actors Category:English voice actors Category:English writers
